error.signature: Error: Invalid count argument: count.index is not valid in this context

verdict.summary: Using count.index outside of a resource that has count, or mixing count with for_each.

dead_ends.action: Using both count and for_each on the same resource
dead_ends.why_fails: Terraform doesn't allow both; pick one

dead_ends.action: Setting count = 0 to skip the resource
dead_ends.why_fails: Works but prevents use of count.index in any expressions

workarounds.action: Use for_each with a map/set instead of count for complex scenarios
workarounds.how: for_each provides each.key and each.value for more control

workarounds.action: Ensure count is set on the resource block before using count.index
workarounds.how: count.index is only valid inside resources/modules with count defined

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both produce similar messages, but 'invalid-count-argument' and 'unsupported-attribute' differ in root cause and environment context.
Both produce similar messages, but 'invalid-count-argument' and 'cycle-in-module' differ in root cause and environment context.
